newsitem.title: NORWAY: Investors seek out Norway blue chips, market flat.
newsitem.headline: Investors seek out Norway blue chips, market flat.

text.p: Norwegian shares remained flat on Wednesday, although sentiment was positive despite reduced volume as the summer lull set in.
Dealers said players continued to search out the blue chip stocks as volatility in short-term interest rates had increased risk in smaller companies.
"Of what little interest there is the main volume is in the blue chips. They appear slightly safer than the smaller caps because of short term interest rates," said one broker.
The Total share index closed 0.23 percent up at 1,183.67 points in moderate turnover of 800 million crowns.
Dealers said offshore technology companies Kvaerner and Aker Maritime continued to gather interest due to the high level of activity in the British, Norwegian and Danish oil sectors.

"This industry is technology driven and there are a lot of developments in Europe, as well as the Gulf of Mexico and West Africa, which are leading to new (hydrocarbon) finds. That's good for suppliers to the oil industry," the broker said.
Forestry group Norske Skog and metals producer Elkem were seen as positive with upward potential following a bottoming out of product prices, dealers said.
